pages.title: Research
pages.text: We are mainly focused on the basic research bout neural stem cells (NSCs). Most of our works have been done in vitro. * NSCs isolated from embryonic cerebral cortex of rats and mouse were cultured routinely in our lab.* NSCs biological behaviors on various conditions, such as hypoxia vs normaloxia, 2D monolayer vs 3D spheroid, were investigated and compared.* NSCs were genetically modified with different genes, such as neurotrophin 3 (NT3), brain derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) via viral vectors. We also interested in neural development.* Distribution of nestin+ cells was observed during rat and mouse development.* Interaction between neural genesis and angiogenesis was observed during development.* Currently, investigation of the influence of high-fat diet and leptin on neural development is ongoing. Preliminary application study of NSCs has also been carried.* Biocompability of NSCs and biomaterial (PHBHHx) and the influence of beta-HB (the degradation product of PHA) on NSCs biological behaviors, in terms of proliferation and differentiation, have been investigated.* Fusion peptide, TAT-KIR was designed and constructed. The influence of TAT-KIR on biological behaviors of NSCs was observed both in vitro and in vivo.* Different animal models, including traumatic brain injury (TBI) and middle cerebral artery occlusion (MCAO) were used for NSCs study* Organotypic brain slices were also used for NSCs study. Research funding have been granted: * The mechanism of miRNA on neurotrophin 3 induced neural regeneration after hypoxic-ischemic brain injury. National Natural Science Foundation of China. 2011.1-2013.12, 330,000 RMB.* Roles and mechanism of SOCS3 in reducing reactive astrogliosis and enhancing functional recovery after ischemic stroke in rat. National Natural Science Foundation of China. 2013.1-2016.12, 900,000 RMB.* The role of Lep-Rb and its down stream signaling pathways in neural regeneration after brain injury. National Natural Science Foundation of China. 2016.1-2019.12, 570,000 RMB.* Fundings from other sources. TBI model (Surgical procedures) Written by Xingxing LiAnimals for TBI were bred for adaption for 3 days, and then the model was performed according to the procedures as below. Briefly, the mouse was anaesthetized with 10% chloral hydrate sodium and positioned in a stereotaxic apparatus. A circular craniectomy, 2 mm in diameter, was performed with a dental drill on the left cranium: anterior/posterior, 0 mm; medial/lateral, +1.0 mm. The exposed site was hit by a weight of 20 g falling freely from 20 cm high. Hemostasis was confirmed before the skin were closed with resorbable 4/0 Ethicon stitches. Rats were then housed in individual cages to recover.
